color:white;"| || align=left|Sustainability Network || align=left|REDE || || 1 || || || || '''1''' |- | !align="center" style="background:{{Workers' Party (Brazil)/meta/color}}; color:white;"| || align=left|[[Workers' Party (Brazil)|Workers' Party]] || align=left|PT || || 11 || || || || '''11''' |- class="sortbottom" style="font-weight:bold" | colspan=3 align=left|Total || 55 || 22 || 1 || 2 || 1 || 81 |} ==Acting president== {{see also|Operation Car Wash}} [[File:Michel Temer Ministerial meeting.jpg|thumb|280px|Michel Temer in his first ministerial meeting on 13 May 2016]] In the Brazilian political system, the president and vice president run on the same ticket but have constitutionally separate terms. Michel Temer, who was president of the Chamber during the [[Fernando Henrique Cardoso]] presidency from 1995 to 2003, is a member of the Brazilian Democratic Movement Party (PMDB), which announced it was running against the Rousseff government in March 2016.{{Cite web | url = https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-36070366 | title = Michel Temer: The man who now leads Brazil | author = Daniel Gallas | work = ''BBC News'' | date = 12 May 2016 | accessdate = 14 May 2016 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20160429114035/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-36070366 | archive-date = 29 April 2016 | dead-url = no | df = dmy-all }}{{Cite web | url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-3514464/Brazils-PMDB-party-abandons-Rousseff-quits-coalition.html | title = Brazil's biggest party abandons president, quits coalition | author1 = Associated Press | work = Daily Maildate= 30 March 2016 | accessdate = 10 April 2017 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20170410220125/http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-3514464/Brazils-PMDB-party-abandons-Rousseff-quits-coalition.html | archive-date = 10 April 2017 | dead-url = no | df = dmy-all }}{{Cite web | url = http://ultimosegundo.ig.com.br/politica/2016-03-29/saida-do-pmdb-do-governo-leva-oposicao-a-se-reorganizar-para-derrubar-dilma.html | title = Saída do PMDB do governo leva oposição a se reorganizar para derrubar Dilma | trans-title = PMDB leaves government and takes opposition to reorganize to impeach Dilma | author1 = David Shalom | author2 = Nicolas Iory | publisher = Último Segundo | date = 29 March 2016 | accessdate = 20 May 2016 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20160604013418/http://ultimosegundo.ig.com.br/politica/2016-03-29/saida-do-pmdb-do-governo-leva-oposicao-a-se-reorganizar-para-derrubar-dilma.html | archive-date = 4 June 2016 | dead-url = no | df = dmy-all }} According to [[the Guardian]],
"...for those desperate for change, Temer represents salvation. Others, more concerned about the country's fragile democracy, believe he is the perpetrator of a coup."{{cite web | url = https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/apr/03/brazil-michel-temer-dilma-rousseff-impeachment | title = The kingmaker tipped to seize the throne – but will a Temer 'coup' divide or unite Brazil? | first = Jonathan | last = Watts | date = 3 April 2016 | work = The Guardian }}
A separate [[Impeachment proposal against Michel Temer|proposal]] sought to impeach Temer, the official process having started on 6 April 2016 when Cunha formed a commission to investigate one impeachment request among the five made against Temer.{{cite web | url = http://g1.globo.com/politica/noticia/2016/04/cunha-rejeita-pedido-de-impeachment-de-temer-feito-por-cid-gomes.html | title = Cunha rejeita pedido de impeachment de Temer feito por Cid Gomes | publisher = G1 | author = Fernanda Calgaro | date = 5 April 2016 | access-date = 5 April 2016 | language = pt }} In March 2017, former [[Odebrecht|Odebrecht Group]] CEO [[Marcelo Odebrecht]], as part of a [[plea bargain]] for leniency, said before the Superior Electoral Court Judge Herman Benjamin, that PMDB and PT [[slush fund]]s received payments of R$150 million (US$48 million) from Odebrecht's construction conglomerate for the 2014 re-election campaign in 2014, and that at least a third of the money originated from corrupt practices. Odebrecht was jailed in June 2015 for corruption uncovered by Operation Car Wash.{{cite news | url = http://riotimesonline.com/brazil-news/rio-politics/odebrecht-confirms-donations-to-brazils-rousseff-temer-ticket/ | title = Odebrecht Confirms Illegal Donations to Brazil's Rousseff-Temer Campaign | author = Lise Alves | date = 2 March 2017 | accessdate = 15 April 2017 | work = The Rio Times }}{{cite news | url = http://www.efe.com/efe/english/world/brazilian-elections-agency-cancels-hearing-on-rousseff-temer-campaign/50000262-3228563# | title = Brazilian elections agency cancels hearing on Rousseff-Temer campaign | date = 4 April 2017 | accessdate = 15 April 2017 | publisher = [[EFE Agency]] }} ===Public opinion=== A CNT/MDA poll published on 8 June 2016, indicated that only 11.3% of Brazilians approved while 28% disapproved of the acting government of President Temer. For 30.2% of respondents, Temer's government is ordinary, while 30.5% gave no answer. The survey also showed that 46.6% of Brazilians believed that the corruption in Temer's government could equal that in Rousseff's government. 28.3% believed that corruption could be less and the remaining 18.6% estimated that it could be even greater. Regarding the lawfulness of the process of impeachment, 61.5% agreed with the conduct of the process, 33.3% answered negatively and 5.2% didn't answer. CNT/MDA polled 2,002 people in 137 municipalities in 25 federative units between 2 and 5 June. CNT/MDA reported the poll as 95% reliable with a 2% margin of error.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/cnt-reprovacao-do-governo-temer-e-de-28-11-aprovam-e-30-consideram-regular | title = CNT: reprovação do governo Temer é de 28%; 11% aprovam e 30% consideram regular | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Pedro Peduzzi | date = 8 June 2016 | accessdate = 11 June 2016 | language = pt }}{{cite web | url = http://cnt.mdapesquisa.com.br/img/RelatorioSINTESE-CNTJUNHO2016-R131.pdf | title = Pesquisa CNT/MDA 2 a 5 de junho de 2016 | publisher = CNT/MDA | date = 8 June 2016 | accessdate = 11 June 2016 | format = PDF | language = pt }} An [[Ipsos]] poll in early July 2016 investigated what outcome most Brazilians were hoping for, with mixed results: 16% of Brazilians preferred Temer in office; 20% said that Rousseff should be acquitted and finish her four-year mandate; and 52% said that whoever assumed the presidency should call new elections for president. However, holding new elections would only be possible with a 3/5 majority in both houses of congress. Alternatively, both could have been removed from office, depending on the outcome of a lawsuit filed in the Superior Electoral Court by the [[Brazilian Social Democracy Party|PSDB]], party of Aécio Neves, the defeated candidate in the 2014 presidential elections, whose suit alleged electoral crime by the political alliance of Rousseff-Temer involving donations from the companies implicated in Operation Car Wash.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-08/brazil-companies-shows-no-proof-services-rousseff-and-temers-campaign | title = Brazil: Companies show no proof of services for Rousseff and Temer's campaign | publisher = [[Agência Brasil]] | author = Michelle Canes | date = 23 August 2016 | accessdate = 24 August 2016 }}{{cite web | url = http://www.bbc.com/portuguese/brasil-36779469 | title = Nem Dilma, nem Temer: maioria da população quer eleição antecipada, aponta nova pesquisa | publisher = [[BBC Brasil]] | author = Mariana Schreiber | date = 26 July 2016 | accessdate = 30 July 2016 | language = pt }}{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-07/most-brazilians-want-new-presidential-vote-year | title = Survey: Most Brazilians want new presidential vote this year | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Felipe Pontes | date = 26 July 2016 | accessdate = 30 July 2016 }} ==Impeachment trial== After the Senate vote to suspend Rousseff's presidential powers and duties, subsequent procedure required new citations, new defense, appointing witnesses and producing evidence for preparation of the final report, which first of all had to be reviewed by a committee and then the entire Senate, each requiring a simple majority to confirm that the charges were well-founded. After that, the debate over conviction or acquittal began, requiring a two-thirds majority of the Senate, which proceedings were chaired by [[Ricardo Lewandowski]]. This eventually resulted in Rousseff's permanent removal, the appeal of which was denied by the court.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-05/trial-brazil-president-rousseff-may-end-august | title = Trial of Brazil President Rousseff may end in August | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Karine Melo | date = 25 May 2016 | accessdate = 18 April 2017 }}{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-05/impeachment-de-dilma-pode-ter-decisao-final-em-agosto-diz-relator | title = Impeachment de Dilma pode ter decisão final em agosto, diz relator | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Karine Melo | language = pt | date = 25 May 2016 | accessdate = 5 June 2016 }}{{Cite web | url = http://g1.globo.com/politica/processo-de-impeachment-de-dilma/noticia/2016/05/cronograma-do-impeachment-sera-apresentado-na-proxima-terca-diz-lira.html | title = Cronograma do impeachment será apresentado na próxima terça, diz Lira | author = Renan Ramalho | publisher = Globo | date = 17 May 2016 | accessdate = 22 May 2016 | language = pt | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20160522051925/http://g1.globo.com/politica/processo-de-impeachment-de-dilma/noticia/2016/05/cronograma-do-impeachment-sera-apresentado-na-proxima-terca-diz-lira.html | archive-date = 22 May 2016 | dead-url = no | df = dmy-all }} ===Rousseff's defense=== Rousseff had 20 days to present a preliminary written defense for the trial in the Senate and Rousseff's lawyer [[José Eduardo Cardozo]] did so on 1 June 2016.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-06/today-last-day-brazils-suspended-president-submit-written-defense | title = Today last day for Brazil's suspended president to submit written defense | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Karine Melo | date = 1 June 2016 | accessdate = 1 June 2016 }}{{cite web | url = http://noticias.uol.com.br/politica/ultimas-noticias/2016/06/01/dilma-entrega-defesa-a-comissao-do-impeachment-no-senado.htm | title = Cardozo entrega defesa de Dilma à comissão do impeachment no Senado | publisher = UOL Notícias | author = Gustavo Maia | date = 1 June 2016 | accessdate = 1 June 2016 | language = pt }} filed the document in evidence. [[File:José Eduardo Cardozo CEI2016.jpg|thumb|200px|
José Eduardo Cardozo, lawyer who represented Rousseff]] His 370-page filing said that the president had not committed the alleged crimes and that Rousseff's impeachment "was solely and exclusively aimed at ending Operation Car Wash." Cardozo submitted as evidence transcripts of a recorded telephone conversation between {{Interlanguage link multi|José Sérgio Machado|pt|Sérgio Machado (político e empresário)}}, former president of Petrobras subsidiary [[Transpetro]], and Senator [[Romero Jucá]], an influential politician in the PMDB. Published by the newspaper [[Folha de S. Paulo]], the conversation convinced Cardozo that the two were trying to prevent the investigation from widening, due to the risk to both of being caught up in it, and suggested that Rousseff's impeachment could have been part of an agreement aimed at preventing (and possibly later stopping) the Operation Car Wash investigations.{{cn|reason=allegations of criminality require a solid reference even though sourced.|date=May 2017}} Jucá's lawyer said that his client never thought to interfere in Operation Car Wash and that the dialogue did not suggest that he did.{{cite web | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/24/world/americas/brazil-dilma-rousseff-impeachment-petrobras.html | title = Transcript Suggests a Plot Behind Effort to Oust Brazilian President | work = The New York Times | author = Vinod Seeharsha | date = 23 May 2016 | accessdate = 1 June 2016 }}{{cite web | url = http://www1.folha.uol.com.br/poder/2016/05/1774018-em-dialogos-gravados-juca-fala-em-pacto-para-deter-avanco-da-lava-jato.shtml | title = Em diálogos gravados, Jucá fala em pacto para deter avanço da Lava Jato | work = Folha de S. Paulo | author = Pedro Ladeira | date = 5 April 2016 | accessdate = 2 June 2016 | language = pt }} Jucá, who had been appointed [[Ministry of Planning, Budget, and Management|Planning Minister]] by Temer, also denied ever attempting to obstruct the investigation, and after speaking with Temer on 23 May, said that he had no intention of resigning.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-05/brazil-minister-denies-pact-aimed-stopping-car-wash-probe | title = Brazil minister denies pact aimed at stopping Car Wash probe | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Carolina Pimentel / Nira Foster | date = 23 May 2016 | accessdate = 1 September 2016 }} However, the next day Jucá stepped down after eleven days in office.{{cite web | url = http://edition.cnn.com/2016/05/23/americas/brazil-politics/ | title = More turmoil in Brazil as new Cabinet minister steps down | publisher = CNN | author = Ivan Watson | date = 24 May 2016 | accessdate = 4 September 2016 }} ===Committee meetings=== ====Work plan and preliminary requests==== On 25 May 2016, Senator [[Antônio Anastasia]], ''[[rapporteur]]'' of the Special Committee of Impeachment 2016 (CEI 2016),{{cite web | url = http://legis.senado.leg.br/comissoes/comissao?1&codcol=2016 | title = Comissão Especial do Impeachment 2016 | trans-title = Special Committee of Impeachment | publisher = Senado Federal | language = pt }} presented a work plan for the trial. The next meeting was scheduled for 2 June, to analyze new deadlines. The committee assessed Anastasia's report and work plan deadlines, and requests by senators{{clarify|date=April 2017}}, on 2 June 2016.{{cite web | url = http://legis.senado.leg.br/comissoes/reuniao;jsessionid=F9570CCD17D9CECA99EFFA6BE7F07B72?0&reuniao=4968&codcol=2016 | title = CEI2016 – 11ª Reunião | publisher = Senado Federal | date = 2 June 2016 | accessdate = 5 June 2016 | language = pt }} in a session that lasted over nine hours. Anastasia proposed that final arguments be heard by 7 July. Anastasia ruled against recorded telephone conversation between Machado and Jucá being introduced into evidence, ruling it irrelevant since the charges against Rousseff were fiscal responsibility crimes and the recording was only an informal conversation and proved nothing in law. Cardozo protested that the facts cited in the recording were a primary question of the investigation, and announced on 3 June that he would appeal the decision to the president of the Supreme Court.{{cite web | url = https://www.wsj.com/articles/brazils-rousseff-to-fight-effort-to-speed-up-impeachment-trial-1464994394 | title = Brazil's Rousseff to Fight Effort to Speed Up Impeachment Trial | work = The Wall Street Journal | author1 = Paulo Trevisani | author2 = Rogerio Jelmayer | date = 3 June 2016 | accessdate = 5 June 2016 }}{{cite web | url = http://noticias.uol.com.br/politica/ultimas-noticias/2016/06/03/cardozo-vai-apresentar-4-recursos-ao-stf-contra-comissao-do-impeachment.htm | title = Defesa de Dilma recorre ao STF contra prazo na comissão do impeachment | trans-title = Defense of Dilma appeals to STF against deadline on impeachment committee | publisher = UOL Notícias | author = Gustavo Maia | date = 3 June 2016 | accessdate = 5 June 2016 | language = pt }} The committee approved the work plan and deadlines on 6 June.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-06/brazil-impeachment-trial-expected-end-halfway-rio-olympics | title = Brazil: Impeachment trial expected to end halfway into Rio Olympics | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 7 June 2016 | accessdate = 11 June 2016 }} On 7 June, Lewandowski denied the appeal filed by Cardozo to append the recording of Sérgio Machado, citing a precedent that evidence of that type is confidential until the beginning of a formal investigation. Machado was arrested and introduced the recording of the conversation during his interrogation. The subject under appeal had been discussed in prior decisions of the Court.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/lewandowski-nega-recurso-para-juntar-ao-processo-audios-feitos-por-machado | title = Lewandowski nega recurso de Dilma para juntar áudios ao processo de impeachment | trans-title = Lewandowski denies Dilma's appeal to join audios to the impeachment process | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Michèlle Canes | date = 8 June 2016 | accessdate = 11 June 2016 | language = pt }} Lewandowski also denied an appeal by senator [[Aloysio Nunes]], former member of the Committee, to reduce the number of witnesses. At 2 June meeting, the Committee had established that eight witnesses would be heard for each of the six supplemental budget decrees against Rousseff, both for the prosecution and for the defense, i.e. a total of 48 witnesses for each side, with each decree considered separately. Nunes contended that the six decrees should be considered a single entity, to be added to the so-called "tax pedaling", so that the number of witnesses to be heard could be reduced to 16.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/lewandowski-mantem-decisao-da-comissao-do-impeachment-sobre-testemunhas | title = Lewandowski mantém decisão da Comissão do Impeachment sobre testemunhas | trans-title = Lewandowski maintains Impeachment Committee's decision on witnesses | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = André Richter | date = 7 June 2016 | accessdate = 11 June 2016 | language = pt }} [[File:Janaína Conceição Paschoal CEI2016.jpg|thumb|left|200px|
Janaína Conceição Paschoal, prosecutor]] On 8 June, the committee accepted a request by both defense and prosecution reducing to four the number of supplemental budget decrees to be considered in the trial. Thus, the number of witnesses in the process was reduced to forty. Since each charge entitled eight witnesses, the defense of Rousseff could introduce up to 32 witnesses for the four decrees and eight for the "tax pedaling" charge. The prosecution would be entitled to the same number. The decision to reduce the charges was supported by a report produced at the House of Representatives, which considered that two decrees signed by Rousseff without approval of Congress were neutral from a fiscal perspective, once the primary sources and financial expenses listed in the documents were equivalent.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/comissao-do-impeachment-reduz-numero-de-testemunhas-nesta-etapa-do-processo | title = Comissão do Impeachment reduz número de testemunhas nesta etapa do processo | trans-title = Impeachment Committee reduces number of witnesses on this phase of the process | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Karine Melo | date = 8 June 2016 | accessdate = 11 June 2016 | language = pt }} ====Witnesses==== The hearings began on 8 June 2016 with four prosecution witnesses. The prosecutors were [[Janaína Paschoal]] and Miguel Reale Junior; Rousseff was represented by her lawyer, José Eduardo Cardozo. {{pull quote|1=Fraud is the will to, free and consciously, to practice the misconduct and get the result. And that's what the President did. She edited the decrees by a free and conscious mode to increase costs, that could not increased by a decree. She should send a [[Bill (law)|bill]].|width=25%|float=right |author= Julio Marcelo de Oliveira, [[Federal Court of Accounts]] (TCU) |source= Agência Brasil.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/procurador-diz-senadores-que-dilma-praticou-crime-com-pedaladas-e-decretos | title = Procurador diz a senadores que Dilma praticou crime com pedaladas e decretos | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 8 June 2016 | accessdate = 12 June 2016 | language = pt }}}} Oliveira, procurator of the [[Federal Court of Accounts]] (TCU), said that in April 2015 TCU identified the recidivist fiscal misconduct, so-called "tax pedaling", immediately rejected. There was no previous understanding to modify the rules and the consensus, and every time that the TCU has ruled, it had disapproved the conduct adopted by Rousseff. He reiterated that the President acted intentionally to borrow from public banks, and acted "coercively" in these operations. This, in his opinion, was serious, and forbidden by the fiscal responsibility law. The practice, he said, went on for years, including throughout the year 2015.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/procurador-diz-que-tecnicos-do-ministerio-da-fazenda-foram-massacrados | title = Procurador diz que técnicos do Ministério da Fazenda foram "massacrados" | trans-title = Prosecutor says that Finance Ministry technicians were "massacred" | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 8 June 2016 | accessdate = 12 June 2016 | language = pt }} Antonio Carlos Costa D'avila Carvalho, the auditor of TCU, said that the Rousseff's fiscal practices were unprecedented and caused serious outcomes.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/auditor-do-tcu-diz-que-praticas-fiscais-do-governo-dilma-foram-atos-graves | title = Auditor do TCU diz que práticas fiscais do governo Dilma foram atos "graves" | trans-title = TCU's auditor says that Dilma's fiscal practices were "serious" | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 8 June 2016 | accessdate = 12 June 2016 | language = pt }} Adriano Pereira de Paula, credit operations manager of the National Treasury, and Otavio Ladeira de Medeiros, deputy secretary of the National Treasury, also testified during this session.{{what|date=May 2017}} Prosecution witnesses Tiago Alves de Gouveia Lins Dutra and Leonardo Rodrigues Albernaz, both TCU auditors, testified on 13 June. Tiago Dutra said that Rousseff created overdrafts with public banks in 2015 that had already observed in 2014. A TCU report indicated a delay of eleven months in transferring to banks an amount of R$2.6 billion, and five months in transferring R$3 billion related to the operations. For principal and interest, until December 2015, the government have been paid R$15 billion, of which R$2 billion were related to interest.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/secretario-do-tcu-confirma-operacoes-de-credito-entre-governo-e-bancos | title = Secretário do TCU confirma operações de crédito entre governo e bancos públicos | trans-title = TCU Secretary confirms loan operations between government and public banks | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 13 June 2016 | accessdate = 18 June 2016 | language = pt }} Albernaz said that more than fifty auditors had carried out an analysis of Rousseff accounts and concluded unanimously that her administration has made "the most reckless management" of public finances since the Fiscal Responsibility Law was enacted in May 2000.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-06/brazil-federal-auditor-says-rousseff-govt-guilty-reckless-management | title = Brazil: Federal auditor says Rousseff govt guilty of reckless management | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 14 June 2016 | accessdate = 18 June 2016 }} Committee President [[Raimundo Lira]] announced the decision of the President of the Supreme Court, Ricardo Lewandowski, authorizing an audit requested by the defense. Lira designated a board consisting of three experts, granting to prosecution, defense and Senators 48 hours to formulate questions and indicate technical assistants, as well as 24 hours to refute the appointed experts, fixing also a ten-day deadline for the completion of the audit.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/documentos-do-impeachment-vao-passar-por-pericia-de-tecnicos-do-senado | title = Documentos do impeachment vão passar por perícia de técnicos do Senado | trans-title = Impeachment documents will be analyzed by Senate technicians | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 14 June 2016 | accessdate = 18 June 2016 | language = pt }} {{pull quote|1=I don't understand that it was a credit operation, but a rendering of services. At no time that the Union [Government] pays to bank was directly related to what the [[Producer (agriculture)|producers]] has received. The producers received from the bank itself. The Union participation doesn't characterize a credit operation between the Union and public banks.|width=25%|float=right |author= Gilson Bittencourt, former National Secretary of Planning and Strategic Investment |source= Agência Brasil.}} On 14 June, the first defense witnesses testified. They were former Secretary of Planning and Strategic Investment, Gilson Bittencourt, and former Secretary of Agricultural Policy of the [[Ministry of Agriculture (Brazil)|Ministry of Agriculture]], André Nassar. Bittencourt said that there was no credit operation between the Government and public banks and also denied that there was a delay in paying interest to public banks in 2015. According to him, the debit to be paid in 2016 came due only at the time of collection by the banks, every six months.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/impeachment-testemunha-diz-que-nao-houve-operacao-de-credito-com-bancos | title = Impeachment: testemunha diz que não houve operação de crédito com banco público | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Felipe Pontes | date = 14 June 2016 | accessdate = 18 June 2016 | language = pt }} Nassar said that the Bank of Brazil had an interest in "circulating money", by lending to producers, and even in getting the transfers delayed by the government. He also said that, as Secretary of Agricultural Policy and from the point of view of the agricultural sector, this was important to avoid a disruption that, had it occurred, would have generated serious outcomes to the sector.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/comissao-do-impeachment-testemunha-diz-que-nao-houve-prejuizo-no-plano | title = Comissão do Impeachment: testemunha diz que não houve prejuízo no Plano Safra | trans-title = Impeachment Committee: witness says that there was no loss in the "Crop Plan" | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 14 June 2016 | accessdate = 18 June 2016 | language = pt }} On 15 June, former Deputy Secretary of the Federal Budget Office, Cilair Rodrigues de Abreu, former Secretary of Budget and Administration for the [[Ministry of Social Security]], José Geraldo França Diniz, and Consultant for the Ministry of Planning, Budget, and Management, Walter Baere de Araújo Filho, all testified. Rodrigues said that the understanding of the TCU before 2015 had always been that the future target could be used by the budget secretary in the publication of their reports. This understanding did not change, he said, until 2015.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/ex-secretario-de-orcamento-diz-que-decretos-nao-violaram-meta-fiscal-em | title = Ex-secretário de Orçamento diz que decretos não violaram meta fiscal em 2015 | trans-title = Former Secretary of Budget says that decrees did not violate fiscal target in 2015 | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Felipe Pontes | date = 15 June 2016 | accessdate = 19 June 2016 | language = pt }} Diniz testified that due to the complexity of supplemental budget decrees, the documents are reviewed by experts and that while Rousseff signed, it would have been impossible for herself to analyze in detail 200 pages of attachments, calculations and spreadsheets. Walter Baere said that the TCU had never issued a formal opinion concerning the illegality of supplemental budget decrees by the President, and that the TCU had the specific legal duty to raise an alert whenever there is a possibility of the non-attainment of fiscal targets.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/comissao-do-impeachment-dispensa-ultima-testemunha-apos-ouvir-tres-tecnicos | title = Comissão do Impeachment dispensa última testemunha após ouvir três técnicos | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 15 June 2016 | accessdate = 19 June 2016 | language = pt }} Former Executive Secretary of the [[Ministry of Education (Brazil)|Ministry of Education]], {{Interlanguage link multi|Luiz Cláudio Costa|pt|3=Luiz Cláudio Costa}}, former Assistant Executive Secretary of the Ministry of Education, Wagner Vilas Boas, Assistant Secretary of Planning and Budget of the Ministry of Education, Iara Ferreira Pinho, and Director of the Department of Economic Programs of the Secretary of Federal Budget, Clayton Luiz Montes, all testified on 16 June. According to Luiz Claudio Costa, the supplemental budget decree for the Ministry of EducationThe supplemental budget decree for the Ministry of Education was one of the four decrees cited in the impeachment process against President Rousseff. was important for the management, enabling several sectors linked to the Ministry, such as universities, institutes and others, to ensure their budget met immediate needs.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/prosseguem-depoimentos-de-testemunhas-de-defesa-na-comissao-do-impeachment | title = Prosseguem depoimentos de testemunhas de defesa na Comissão do Impeachment | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 16 June 2016 | accessdate = 19 June 2016 | language = pt }} Vilas Boas explained that it was not appropriate for the Ministry of Education to evaluate the impact of the credit opening for obtaining the primary balance target. He said that the sectorial authority – in this case the agencies of the Ministry – makes a request for supplemental budget, but that this is subject to policy guidance and technical supervision by the budget agency. Both, Wagner Vilas Boas and Iara Pinho, said they could not give an opinion on the compatibility of the signed supplementary decrees and the current fiscal target since their functions don't allow them to conduct an analysis of the achievement of the target. Concerning these statements, the prosecution pointed out that the technicians were not able to explain specifically the possible crime of responsibility. "The witnesses left show that they are unaware the facts. Our claim is that the evidence shall be excused," said prosecution lawyer, Janaína Paschoal, after the testimony of Iara Pinho.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/depoimento-na-comissao-do-impeachment-tem-discussao-entre-defesa-e-acusacao | title = Depoimento na Comissão do Impeachment tem discussão entre defesa e acusação | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 16 June 2016 | accessdate = 19 June 2016 | language = pt }}{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/apos-reclamacao-da-defesa-comissao-do-impeachment-muda-coordenador-de | title = Após reclamação da defesa, Comissão do Impeachment muda coordenador de perícia | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 16 June 2016 | accessdate = 19 June 2016 | language = pt }} Clayton Luiz Montes said that "the government has followed the new understanding of the TCU by October 2015. Since that time, we were not sent any credit decrees".{{cite web | url = http://www12.senado.leg.br/noticias/materias/2016/06/16/diretor-se-baseia-na-loa-para-defender-decretos-de-dilma | title = Diretor se baseia na LOA para defender decretos de Dilma | publisher = Agência Senado | date = 16 June 2016 | accessdate = 20 June 2016 | language = pt }} This, nevertheless, conflicted with the statements of TCU auditors{{mdash}}that there was no previous understanding to modify the rules. On 17 June, former Minister of Planning, Budget and Management, [[Nelson Barbosa]], former Minister of Education, {{Interlanguage link multi|José Henrique Paim|pt|3=José Henrique Paim}}, Director of the Department of Infrastructure Programs of the Federal Budget Secretary, Zarak de Oliveira Ferreira, Analyst of Planning and Budget of the Ministry of Planning, Budget and Management, Antonio José Chatack Carmelo, and Planning and Budget Analyst of the Federal Budget Office, Georgimar Martiniano de Sousa, testified. Nelson Barbosa said that the additional credit decrees issued by President Rousseff from June to August 2015 did not prevent the fulfillment of the fiscal target approved by Congress in early 2015 and, since it was a supplemental credit that had no impact on the target, was not considered a target of primary balance, but to give more autonomy to the allocation of a value already available.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/para-barbosa-proposta-de-temer-para-limitar-gastos-confirma-inocencia-de | title = Para Barbosa, proposta de Temer para limitar gastos confirma inocência de Dilma | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Felipe Pontes | date = 17 June 2016 | accessdate = 20 June 2016 | language = pt }} Henrique Paim said that the decrees were essential to the functioning of various sectors of Education, including scientific research and operation of universities. Moreover, according to the former minister, the additional credits are often edited based on revenue generation, provided by "budget units", linked to the Ministry.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/comissao-de-impeachment-suspende-reuniao-apos-depoimento-de-ex-ministro | title = Comissão do Impeachment suspende reunião após depoimento de ex-ministro | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 17 June 2016 | accessdate = 20 June 2016 | language = pt }} Also the technicians Zarak de Oliveira, Chatack Carmelo and Georgimar Martiniano, have not seen incompatibility of supplemental decrees with the fiscal target.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/impeachment-tecnicos-nao-viram-incompatibilidade-de-decretos-com-meta | title = Impeachment: técnicos não viram incompatibilidade de decretos com meta fiscal | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 17 June 2016 | accessdate = 20 June 2016 | language = pt }} From 20 to 24 June, there were five meetings, with hearings of fifteen witnesses called by the defense. On 20 June, former Deputy Chief for Legal Affairs of [[Chief of Staff of Brazil|Staff of the Presidency]] Ivo da Motta Azevedo Correa, former Minister of Education [[Renato Janine Ribeiro]] Director of the Department of Social Programs of the Secretary of Federal Budget Felipe Daruich Neto, and former Deputy Executive Secretary of the Staff of the Presidency Bruno Moretti, all testified. Ivo Correa said that an alert of the TCU was not a decision of the Court, and thus, the government relied on previous jurisprudence to edit the decrees. Janine Ribeiro said that no alert was received from the TCU about irregularities in the supplemental budget decrees when Minister of Education.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/janine-diz-na-comissao-de-impeachment-que-nao-recebeu-alerta-do-tcu | title = Janine diz na Comissão de Impeachment que não recebeu alerta do TCU | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 20 June 2016 | accessdate = 26 June 2016 | language = pt }} Daruich Neto said that, at no time was there any intentional misconduct and that it was impracticable for the President to evaluate all decrees before signing them.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/decretos-de-suplementacao-para-o-mec-nao-alteraram-limites-diz-tecnico | title = Decretos de suplementação para o MEC não alteraram limites, diz técnico | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 20 June 2016 | accessdate = 26 June 2016 | language = pt }} Former Minister of the {{Interlanguage link multi|Secretary of Human Rights|pt|3=Secretaria de Direitos Humanos da Presidência da República}} {{Interlanguage link multi|Pepe Vargas|pt}}, former Minister of Planning, Budget and Management {{Interlanguage link multi|Miriam Belchior|pt}} (who was also the former President of Caixa Econômica Federal), Planning and Budget Analyst Orlando Magalhães da Cunha, and Coordinator of Budget and Finance of the Ministry of Justice Marcelo Minghelli, testified on 21 June. The former Minister Pepe Vargas asserted that the supplemental credit to the Secretary of Human Rights was derived not just from treasury resources, but from surplus funds obtained through donations by individuals and corporations.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/pepe-vargas-defende-edicao-de-decretos-na-comissao-do-impeachment | title = Pepe Vargas defende edição de decretos na Comissão do Impeachment | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Pedro Peduzzi | date = 21 June 2016 | accessdate = 26 June 2016 | language = pt }} Mirian Belchior said that the supplemental budget decrees, by which Rousseff was indicted were lawful and that it was impossible to increase the budgetary contingency that was made in 2015.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/miriam-diz-na-comissao-do-impeachment-que-decretos-de-dilma-nao-foram | title = Decretos de Dilma não foram ilegais, diz ex-ministra na Comissão do Impeachment | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 21 June 2016 | accessdate = 26 June 2016 | language = pt }} Planning and Budget Analyst and General Coordinator of Technology and Information of the Federal Budget Office Robson Azevedo Rung, Secretary of Institutional Organization of the [[Ministry of Defence (Brazil)|Ministry of Defence]] Luiz Antonio de Souza Cordeiro, and [[Superior Labor Court]] representative Luciano Carlos de Almeida testified on 22 June. Azevedo Rung said that the Federal Budget Office received a new interpretation from TCU only in 2015, concerning the procedures that were ever well settled.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/impeachment-analista-diz-no-senado-que-houve-mudanca-do-entendimento-do-tcu | title = Impeachment: analista aponta mudança em entendimento do TCU sobre créditos | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Ana Cristina Campos | date = 22 June 2016 | accessdate = 26 June 2016 | language = pt }} Also at this session, the Committee approved a new [[timetable]] for the trial {{ndash}} on 6 July, the testimony of Rousseff, who could be represented by her lawyer, José Eduardo Cardozo; from 7 to 12 July, final arguments of the prosecution; and from 13 to 27 July, final arguments of the defence. On 9 August, there was to be discussion and voting on the report in plenary; and 22 August was the estimated date for the final judgement.{{cite web | url = http://www.valor.com.br/international/news/4611073/final-rousseff-trial-may-only-happen-late-august | title = Final Rousseff trial may only happen in late August | publisher = Valor International | date = 23 June 2016 | accessdate = 26 June 2016 }}{{cite web | url = http://politica.estadao.com.br/noticias/geral,comissao-do-impeachment-aprova-novo-calendario-e-dilma-deve-prestar-depoimento-em-6-de-julho,10000058694 | title = Comissão do impeachment aprova novo calendário e Dilma deve prestar depoimento em 6 de julho | work = O Estado de S. Paulo | author = Isabela Bonfim e Julia Lindner | date = 22 June 2016 | accessdate = 26 June 2016 | language = pt }} [[File:CEI 2016 23 June 2016.jpg|thumb|250px|
Committee meeting on 23 June 2016]] The Deputy Secretary of Planning, Budget and Administration of the [[Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation (Brazil)|Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation]] Anderson Lozi da Rocha and former Federal Budget Secretary Esther Dweck testified on 23 June. Dweck denied that the supplemental budget decrees in 2015 had contributed to the breach of the target for primary surplus for that year.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/ex-secretaria-nega-interferencia-da-edicao-de-decretos-no-cumprimento-da | title = Ex-secretária nega interferência da edição de decretos no cumprimento da meta | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 23 June 2016 | accessdate = 26 June 2016 | language = pt }} Two more witnesses (former Executive Secretary of the [[Ministry of Labor and Employment (Brazil)|Ministry of Labor and Employment]] Francisco José Pontes Ibiapina and the Director of Special Programs of the Secretary of Federal Budget Marcos de Oliveira Ferreira) testified on 24 June. Pontes Ibiapina said that the supplemental budget decrees were published to aid programs such as the transfer of resources to States and Municipalities, by the {{Interlanguage link multi|National Employment System|pt|3=Sistema Nacional de Emprego}} and other programs.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/impeachment-comissao-encerra-semana-com-depoimentos-de-testemunhas-de | title = Impeachment: comissão encerra semana com depoimentos de testemunhas de defesa | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Ana Cristina Campos | date = 24 June 2016 | accessdate = 26 June 2016 | language = pt }} Former [[Ministry of Agrarian Development (Brazil)|Ministry of Agrarian Development]] [[Patrus Ananias]] testified on 27 June. Ananias said that he did not acknowledge the "tax pedalling" and the resources were transferred from the Bank of Brazil directly to producers at subsidized interest rates, due to the attention that agriculture deserved.{{cite web | url = http://g1.globo.com/politica/processo-de-impeachment-de-dilma/noticia/2016/06/comissao-de-impeachment-ouve-ex-ministro-de-dilma-no-senado.html | title = Comissão de impeachment ouve ex-ministro de Dilma no Senado | publisher = G1 Política | date = 27 June 2016 | accessdate = 4 July 2016 | language = pt }} On 28 June were heard {{Interlanguage link multi|Maria Fernanda Ramos Coelho|pt}}, former Executive Secretary of the Ministry of Agrarian Development; [[Aldo Rebelo]], former Ministry of Defence; [[Luís Inácio Adams]], former [[Attorney General of Brazil|General's Office attorney]]; and Antônio Carlos Stangherlin Rebelo, who was responsible for analysis of supplemental credits on the [[National Justice Council]]. Maria Fernanda said that the delay in the payment of interest rate equalization of the Plan Safra (government's plan to support agriculture) for 2015, did not configure a credit operation, since the non-compliance was not subject to penalty payment in the contract terms. According to former Secretary, the values were only monetarily adjusted. The prosecution lawyer Janaína Paschoal rejected the claims of Maria Fernanda and said that the remuneration per {{Interlanguage link multi|interest rate SELIC|pt|3=taxa SELIC}} (a benchmark interest rate of the Brazilian economy) is a proof that there was a credit operation. The prosecution reiterated that this statement confirmed the infringement materially, she concluded.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/testemunha-de-defesa-de-dilma-nega-operacao-de-credito-e-defende-plano | title = Testemunha de defesa de Dilma nega operação de crédito e defende Plano Safra | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Felipe Pontes | date = 28 June 2016 | accessdate = 4 July 2016 | language = pt }} Aldo Rebelo rejected the accusations that the government spent wantonly in 2015, and that year was characterized by fiscal adjustments and efforts to reduce public spending.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/comissao-do-impeachment-concluiu-penultimo-dia-de-depoimentos | title = Comissão do Impeachment conclui penúltimo dia de depoimentos | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 28 June 2016 | accessdate = 4 July 2016 | language = pt }} On 29 June were heard João Luiz Guadagnin, Director of the Department of Finance and Production Protection of the Ministry of Agrarian Development; Marcel Mascarenhas dos Santos, Prosecutor of the [[Central Bank of Brazil|Central Bank]]; Fernando Rocha, Deputy Head of the Economic Department of the Central Bank; and Paulo José dos Reis Souza, Finance and Control Analyst and Fiscal Policy Secretary on the {{Interlanguage link multi|National Treasury Secretary|pt|3=Secretaria do Tesouro Nacional}}.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/impeachment-testemunha-inocenta-dilma-em-atraso-do-plano-safra | title = Impeachment: testemunha inocenta Dilma em atrasos do Plano Safra | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Felipe Pontes | date = 29 June 2016 | accessdate = 4 July 2016 | language = pt }}{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-06/comissao-do-impeachment-encerra-fase-de-depoimentos | title = Comissão do Impeachment encerra fase de depoimentos de testemunhas | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 29 June 2016 | accessdate = 4 July 2016 | language = pt }} The witness hearings ended on 29 June. A total of 44 witnesses were heard, six convened by prosecution and 38 by the defense. At the end of the witnesses hearings phase, both the prosecution and the defense lawyers said they were confident of their respective theses. Prosecution lawyer Janaína Paschoal criticized the actions of Rousseff's defense because of the large number of witnesses called. Defense lawyer José Eduardo Cardozo also expressed confidence, but said that the process had political undertones and that this might interfere with the result. He also pointed out that some senators refused to question the witnesses because there was already a predetermined outcome prior to the completion of work. ====Auditors' report==== The board of experts designated at 13 June session, by committee president Raimundo Lira, was heard on 5 July. This board had audited the documents, as requested by the defense and authorized by Lewandowski. They found that the delays in the transfer of payments to the public banks did indeed constitute loans. However, they avoided considering whether the President intended this and said that this judgement should be made by the senators. Also heard were the assistant to the prosecution, Selene Péres Nunes and the assistant to the defense, Ricardo Lodi Ribeiro. Nunes said that there was willful misconduct by the President, since the operations had been concealed via the accounting and the fact that the government had later issued a [[provisional measure]] allowing payment of the debts.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-07/comissao-do-impeachment-ouve-peritos-e-assistente-de-acusacao | title = Comissão do Impeachment ouve peritos e assistente de acusação | trans-title = Committee of Impeachment hears experts and assistant of prosecution | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 5 July 2016 | accessdate = 29 July 2016 | language = pt }} Ribeiro said that the supplemental budget decrees were submitted for her signature by the technical departments of the ministries, and her participation, as demonstrated in the report, was limited to signing them.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-07/comissao-do-impeachment-conclui-depoimento-de-peritos | title = Comissão do Impeachment conclui depoimentos de peritos | trans-title = Committee of Impeachment concludes testimony of experts | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 5 July 2016 | accessdate = 29 July 2016 | language = pt }} ====Rousseff interrogatory and final arguments==== Rousseff was scheduled to be questioned on 6 July, but she declined to attend and sent a letter that was read by Cardozo.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-07/brazil-rousseff-decides-not-attend-impeachment-commission | title = Brazil: Rousseff decides not to attend impeachment commission | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Denise Griesinger / Nira Foster | date = 6 July 2016 | accessdate = 2 August 2016 }} Rousseff defended herself, claiming that she was the victim of a conspiracy{{mdash}}that "a number of political forces" saw her as a risk and that those who "failed to acknowledge the opposition's defeat [in the [[Brazilian general elections, 2014|2014 elections]]]" wanted a different political party for the country. She also said she acted in ''[[bona fide]]'' and asked lawmakers to "get rid of personal bias".{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-07/brazils-rousseff-restates-she-fell-victim-conspiracy | title = Brazil's Rousseff restates she fell victim to conspiracy | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Karine Melo | date = 6 July 2016 | accessdate = 2 August 2016 }} The final arguments were delivered on 12 July{{cite web | url = https://archive.org/details/CEI2016ProsecutionFinalArguments | title = Alegações Finais da Acusação | author1 = Hélio P. Bicudo | author2 = Miguel Reale Jr | author3 = Janaína C. Paschoal | date = 12 July 2016 | accessdate = 2 August 2016 | language = pt }} and 28 July{{cite web | url = https://archive.org/details/CEI2016DefenceFinalArguments | title = Alegações Finais da Defesa | author = José Eduardo Cardozo | date = 28 July 2016 | accessdate = 2 August 2016 | language = pt }} Note: ''there is a mistake in the date of document reception, written by officer of COCETI (Coordenação de Comissões Especiais, Temporárias e Parlamentares de Inquérito). Rather than 28 June 2016, the correct date is 28 July 2016''. respectively, for preparation of the final report by rapporteur Antonio Anastasia.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-07/brazil-new-deadline-rousseffs-defense-ends-today | title = Brazil: new deadline for Rousseff's defense ends today | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Iolando Lourenço / Luciano Nascimento | date = 28 July 2016 | accessdate = 2 August 2016 }} ====Final report: discussion and approval==== Anastasia submitted the final report on 2 August,{{cite web | url = https://archive.org/details/CEI2016RelatorioPronuncia2DeAgostoDe2016 | title = Relatório Final | publisher = Senado Federal | author = Antonio Anastasia | date = 2 August 2016 | accessdate = 5 August 2016 | language = pt }} concluding that Rousseff was culpable.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-08/rapporteur-rousseffs-case-recommends-trial-senate | title = Rapporteur in Rousseff's case recommends trial by Senate | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Karine Melo | date = 2 August 2016 | accessdate = 11 August 2016 }} On 3 August, the document was discussed by the committee. João Correia Serra, prosecution lawyer [[wikt:in lieu|''in lieu'']], praised Anastasia's report and stressed the known "centralizing temperament" of Rousseff, making it seem unlikely Rousseff had been unaware of or had not directly ordered the actions of which she was accused. Countering, Cardozo said that he was sure that Anastasia's report did not evince that Rousseff had committed crimes, and accused the ''rapporteur'', despite his aptitude and brilliance, of managing his actions within the opinion of his party.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-08/comissao-do-impeachment-conclui-discussao-de-parecer-votacao-sera-amanha | title = Comissão do Impeachment conclui discussão de parecer; votação será amanhã | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 3 August 2016 | accessdate = 5 August 2016 | language = pt }} On 4 August, the report was voted on and approved by 14–5 votes – ending the work of the Committee – followed by voting on the Senate floor on 9 August, chaired by Supreme Federal Court president Ricardo Lewandowski.{{cite web | url = https://www.nytimes.com/reuters/2016/08/09/world/americas/09reuters-brazil-impeachment.html?ref=americas&_r=2 | title = Brazil Senate Meets to Indict Suspended President Rousseff | work = The New York Times | date = 9 August 2016 | accessdate = 13 August 2016 }}{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-08/senate-commission-approves-report-recommending-rousseffs-impeachment | title = Senate commission approves report recommending Rousseff's impeachment | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Karine Melo | date = 4 August 2016 | accessdate = 5 August 2016 }} ===Senate vote on the final report=== At a long session of the Senate – from 9 to 10 August – Anastasia's final report was approved{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-08/impeachment-chief-justice-calls-courage-and-independence-senators | title = Impeachment: Chief Justice calls for courage and independence to senators | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Karine Melo/Carolina Gonçalves | date = 9 August 2016 | accessdate = 13 August 2016 }} and by a 59–21 vote, the indictments against Rousseff were upheld.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-08/brazils-senate-votes-indict-rousseff-impeachable-charges | title = Brazil's Senate votes to indict Rousseff on impeachable charges | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Luciano Nascimento | date = 10 August 2016 | accessdate = 13 August 2016 }}{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-08/impeachment-por-59-votos-21-plenario-do-senado-aprova-denuncia-contra-dilma | title = Impeachment: por 59 votos a 21, plenário do Senado aprova denúncia contra Dilma | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Luciano Nascimento | date = 10 August 2016 | accessdate = 13 August 2016 | language = pt }}{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/sites/_agenciabrasil2013/files/files/Como%20senadores%20votaram.pdf | title = Como os senadores votaram | publisher = Agência Brasil | accessdate = 13 August 2016 | language = pt | trans-title = How the senators voted }} This marked the end of the penultimate phase of the impeachment process, called ''pronunciation'', which would determine the final judgement in the Senate, beginning on 25 August. In this judgement, two-thirds of 81 senators were necessary to remove the President and make her ineligible for office for another eight years with effect from 1 January 2019, when her second term would have ended.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-08/rousseffs-trial-begin-august-25 | title = Rousseff's trial to begin on August 25 | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Karine Melo/Mariana Jungmann | date = 17 August 2016 | accessdate = 21 August 2016 }} ===Deciding Senate vote=== The last phase of the trial consisted of four steps: #Cross-examination of witnesses by Lewandowski and the senators (eight witnesses, two called by the prosecution and six by the defense), followed by cross-examination by prosecution and defense lawyers.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-08/impeachment-comecam-inscricoes-de-senadores-para-questionar-testemunhas | title = Impeachment: começam as inscrições de senadores para questionar testemunhas | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Karine Melo | date = 24 August 2016 | accessdate = 24 August 2016 | language = pt | trans-title = Impeachment: begins the registration of senators to inquire witnesses }} #Cross-examination of Rousseff by senators, #Final arguments by prosecution and defense.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-08/rousseff-decides-make-her-defense-senates-impeachment-trial | title = Rousseff decided to attend final impeachment trial in the Senate | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Alex Rodrigues | date = 17 August 2016 | accessdate = 21 August 2016 }} #Vote by senators. ====Cross-examination of witnesses==== On 25 August, the prosecution called two witnesses, Julio Marcelo de Oliveira, procurator of the TCU, and author of the report recommending the rejection of the 2014 accounts, and Antonio Carlos Costa D'avila Carvalho Júnior, auditor of the TCU. Oliveira was questioned as an expert, not as an evidentiary, witness, as ruled by Lewandowski, after Cardozo accused Oliveira of making a report based on a biased understanding. He denied this, saying that he only fulfilled a recommendation to adopt a "less tolerant" rule that came from TCU. Oliveira asserted that Rousseff broke budget laws in 2014 and also in 2015. In his status as informant, his complaints could not be considered as evidence, but as technical information. The next prosecution witness questioned, D'Avila Carvalho, asserted that Rousseff "disguised" the accounting and was responsible for delaying transfers to state banks. Cardozo tried to disqualify this witness, accusing him of bias because he had helped Oliveira to draft the TCU report, "clearly an unethical situation that violates the principle of impartiality." However, Lewandowski overruled this motion.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-08/first-day-dilma-rousseff-trial-climate-political-confrontation | title = First day of Dilma Rousseff trial in climate of 'political confrontation' | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Luciano Nascimento | date = 26 August 2016 | accessdate = 29 August 2016 }} [[File: Dilma Rousseff impeachment trial.jpg|thumb|left|300px|
Impeachment trial begins on 25 August 2016]] Cross-examination continued the next day when the defense called six witnesses: *{{Interlanguage link multi|Luiz Gonzaga Belluzzo|pt}}, economist, *Geraldo Luiz Mascarenhas Prado, legal advisor, *{{Interlanguage link multi|Luiz Cláudio Costa|pt|3=Luiz Cláudio Costa}}, former Secretary of the [[Ministry of Education (Brazil)|Ministry of Education]], *[[Nelson Barbosa]], former [[Ministry of Planning, Budget, and Management|Minister of Planning, Budget and Management]] *Esther Dweck, former Secretary of Federal Budget *Ricardo Ribeiro Lodi, Law professor at the [[State University of Rio de Janeiro]]. Dweck was found by Lewandowski to have a conflict of interest, since she was being contracted for the office of [[Gleisi Hoffmann]], one of the senators opposed to impeachment. Gonzaga Belluzzo and Ribeiro Lodi testified as [[expert witness]]es.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-08/impeachment-segundo-dia-do-julgamento-tem-manha-tensa-e-tarde-de | title = Impeachment: segundo dia do julgamento tem manhã tensa e tarde de depoimentos | trans-title = Impeachment: second day of trial has tense morning and afternoon of testimonials | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Luciano Nascimento | date = 27 August 2016 | accessdate = 31 August 2016 | language = pt }} Belluzo said that removal of an elected official should require very special care and could only be done in extreme situations, and that the trial wasn't facing one.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-08/lewandowski-nega-pedido-para-professor-de-direito-ser-ouvido-como | title = Lewandowski nega pedido para professor da UFRJ ser ouvido como informante | trans-title = Lewandowski denies request for UFRJ professor to be heard as informant | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann / Iolando Lourenço | date = 26 August 2016 | accessdate = 31 August 2016 | language = pt }} Mascarenhas Prado said that in signing decrees Rousseff had relied on subordinates who vouched for the signings' legality, adding that she "was dismissed for issuing a decree to follow a determination of the National Justice Council". {{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-08/testemunha-de-defesa-de-dilma-diz-que-nao-houve-crime-de-responsabilidade | title = Testemunha de defesa de Dilma diz que não houve crime de responsabilidade | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Mariana Jungmann | date = 26 August 2016 | accessdate = 31 August 2016 | trans-title = Dilma's defense witness says no crime of responsibility | language = pt }} Cláudio Costa said the supplementary credit decrees were used for educational programs. Senator [[Cássio Cunha Lima]] refuted this, stating that the crime was not in the expansion of universities and technical schools, but in the lack of congressional authorization for the decrees.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-08/impeachment-ex-secretario-do-mec-diz-que-decreto-nao-impactou-contas | title = Impeachment: ex-secretário do MEC diz que decreto não impactou contas públicas | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Iolando Lourenço / Luciano Nascimento | date = 27 August 2016 | accessdate = 31 August 2016 | language = pt }} Barbosa said that decrees provide more leeway for the administration of funds when the budget is limited, and are used by experienced officials. Pro-impeachment senators insisted that the decrees had aggravated the economic crisis facing the country. Barbosa countered that the crisis was due to various internal and external factors.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-08/impeachment-former-minister-restates-rousseffs-acts-were-legal | title = Impeachment: Former minister restates Rousseff's acts were legal | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Karine Melo | date = 27 August 2016 | accessdate = 31 August 2016 }} At last, Ribeiro Lodi stated that the decrees issued by the President in July and August 2015 were not, until the time of the trial, considered violations by TCU and that when they were issued, current understanding did not exist.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-08/impeachment-apos-12-horas-termina-fase-de-depoimentos-dilma-sera-ouvida-na | title = Impeachment: após 12 horas, termina fase de depoimentos; Dilma será ouvida na 2ª | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Iolando Oliveira | date = 27 August 2016 | accessdate = 31 August 2016 | language = pt }} ====Cross-examination of Rousseff by senators and final arguments by lawyers==== {{Expand section|date=August 2016}} {{pull quote|1=I know I will be judged, but my conscience is clear. I did not commit a crime.|width=22%|float=right |author= Dilma Rousseff|source=}} [[File:Discurso no Senado Federal (29282582566).jpg|thumb|300px|
Dilma Rousseff at the Senate on 29 August 2016]] Rousseff spoke in her own defense before the Senate on 29 August for 45 minutes, proclaiming her innocence and decrying the impeachment process, noting that many of her accusers faced worse charges than she. {{cite news | url = http://www.latimes.com/world/mexico-americas/la-fg-brazil-impeach-20160328-story.html | title = The politicians voting to impeach Brazil's president are accused of more corruption than she is | work = Los Angeles Times | date = 28 March 2016 | author = Vincent Bevins | accessdate = 15 April 2017 }} "Everybody knows this impeachment process opened with explicit blackmail by the former head of the lower house, Eduardo Cunha," {{cite news | url = https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/aug/29/brazil-president-dilma-rousseff-impeachment-trial | title = Brazil president Dilma Rousseff comes out fighting in impeachment trial: The Workers’ party leader could be ejected from power by the senate within days but the former Marxist guerrilla told her accusers the process amounts to a coup | work = The Guardian | author1 = Jonathan Watts | author2 = Donna Bowater | date = 29 August 2016 | accessdate = 10 April 2016 }} she said. She then answered questions from senators for more than twelve hours. {{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-08/rousseff-makes-final-appeal-senators-vote-their-conscience | title = Rousseff makes final appeal to senators to vote with their conscience | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Luciano Nascimento | date = 30 August 2016 | accessdate = 31 August 2016 }} She explained that she had needed to make difficult choices on the budget, to address declining [[revenue]] and a refusal by opposition in Congress to work with her.{{cite web | url = https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2016/08/30/brazil-rousseff-impeachment-trial/89580662/ | title = Brazil Senate debates fate of Rousseff; final vote Wednesday | work = USA Today | agency = Associated Press | date = 30 August 2016 | accessdate = 1 September 2016 }} She compared her situation with other Brazilian presidents pursued by their opponents, including [[João Goulart]], a leftist ousted in a [[1964 Brazilian coup d'état|military coup in 1964]], and replaced by a 21-year dictatorship. She also compared the effort to impeach her to the torture she endured after agents of the military dictatorship arrested and jailed her as an [[Dilma Rousseff#Guerrilla activity, 1968–69|urban guerrilla]]. Rousseff called the impeachment proceedings a new type of coup and evoked the breakdown of Brazilian democracy in the 1960s before the military coup. Senator [[Ana Amélia Lemos]] in reply expressed respect for her personal history but said that the senators were not there to judge her biography, but the actions of her government. She said Rousseff had broken the law by manipulating the budget to hide economic problems.{{cite web | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2016/08/30/world/americas/brazil-dilma-rousseff-impeachment-trial.html?ref=americas | title = Dilma Rousseff of Brazil Says She Won't Be Silenced in Impeachment Trial | work = The New York Times | author = Simon Romero | date = 29 August 2016 | accessdate = 4 September 2016 }} {{pull quote|1=We are not dealing with a little accounting problem; we are dealing with fraud.|width=18%|float=right |author= Janaína Paschoal|source=}} The proceedings resumed on 30 August with final arguments of the prosecution and defense,{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-08/brazil-accusers-insist-rousseff-committed-impeachable-offense | title = In Brazil, accusers insist Rousseff committed impeachable offense | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Nira Foster | date = 30 August 2016 | accessdate = 5 September 2016 }}{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/en/politica/noticia/2016-08/defense-they-want-suspend-rousseff-because-she-disturbs-them | title = Defense: they want to suspend Rousseff because she disturbs them | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Carolina Gonçalves / Karine Melo | date = 30 August 2016 | accessdate = 5 September 2016 }} followed by speeches from the senators{{mdash}}the speeches lasted twelve hours, ending about 02:30{{nbsp}}am on the 31st.{{cite web | url = http://agenciabrasil.ebc.com.br/politica/noticia/2016-08/apos-12-horas-de-discursos-44-declaram-voto-pelo-impeachment-e-18-contra | title = Após 12 horas de discursos: 44 declaram voto pelo impeachment e 18 contra | publisher = Agência Brasil | author = Luciano Nascimento | date = 31 August 2016 | accessdate = 5 September 2016 | language = pt }} ====Senate vote==== The Senate found President Dilma Rousseff guilty of responsibility crimes and administrative misconduct regarding the federal budget and removed her from office after a vote of 61–20 on 31 August 2016. In a separate vote on whether she should be barred from public office for eight years, senators voted 42-36 in favor. A two-thirds majority of the votes (54 of 81 senators) would have been needed, so she will be able to run for any public office again in the near future. {{cite web | url = https://www.reuters.com/article/us-brazil-impeachment-rousseff-idUSKCN1162HO | title = Brazil's Senate decides not to bar Rousseff from public office | agency = Reuters | date = 31 August 2016 | accessdate = 4 September 2016 }}{{cite web | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/02/world/americas/brazil-economy-michel-temer.html?ref=americas&_r=0 | title = With Impeachment Over, Brazil's Next Challenge Is Its Flailing Economy | work = The New York Times | author = Simon Romero | date = 1 September 2016 | accessdate = 4 September 2016 }} {{cite web | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/01/world/americas/brazil-dilma-rousseff-impeached-removed-president.html?ref=americas | title = Dilma Rousseff Is Ousted as Brazil's President in Impeachment Vote | work = The New York Times | author = Simon Romero | date = 31 August 2016 | accessdate = 4 September 2016 }} {{cite web | url = https://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/01/world/americas/brazil-impeachment-coup.html?ref=americas | title = All Impeachments Are Political. But Was Brazil's Something More Sinister? | work = The New York Times | author = Amanda Taub | date = 31 August 2016 | accessdate = 4 September 2016 }} She has vowed to do so.{{cite news | url = https://www.reuters.com/article/us-brazil-politics-idUSKCN0XE05M | author1 = Anthony Boadle | author2 = Lisandra Paraguassu | agency = Reuters | title = Brazil's Rousseff vows to fight on after impeachment defeat | date = 18 April 2017 | accessdate = 15 April 2017 }} {|class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" style="font-size:100%;
